seo.meta_title: Pico Peak Trail Guide | 1 Routes, Maps & Conditions
seo.meta_description: Explore Pico Peak (3,957 ft) in Vermont. 1 trails with maps, elevation profiles & current conditions.

schema_place.name: Pico Peak
schema_place.description: Pico Peak is a 3,957 foot peak in Vermont offering hiking trails with scenic views.

mainEntity.name: How long does it take to hike Pico Peak?

acceptedAnswer.text: Most routes on Pico Peak take 2-4 hours round trip. The most popular trail is 5.8 miles with Moderate difficulty. Start early, especially on weekends when parking fills quickly.

mainEntity.name: Is Pico Peak hard to hike?

acceptedAnswer.text: Pico Peak is rated Moderate. At 3,957 feet, the trail offers a rewarding hike suitable for most fitness levels. Proper footwear and preparation are essential.

mainEntity.name: Do I need a permit to hike Pico Peak?

acceptedAnswer.text: No hiking permit is required for Pico Peak. However, parking fees may apply at trailheads (typically $3-5/day for WMNF or state parks). A WMNF parking pass covers most White Mountain trailheads.

mainEntity.name: What is the best trail to hike Pico Peak?

acceptedAnswer.text: The most popular route is the Sherburne Pass Trail to Pico, offering Route via Long Trail with Pico Link spur..

mainEntity.name: When is the best time to hike Pico Peak?

acceptedAnswer.text: The best hiking season for Pico Peak is April through November. Spring wildflowers and fall foliage are particularly scenic.

page_content.description:
Rising to 3,957 feet, Pico Peak offers one of Vermont's finest hiking experiences. Whether you're seeking panoramic views, a family-friendly outing, or a quick escape into nature, this peak delivers.

Popular Routes

The most popular route, **Sherburne Pass Trail to Pico**, covers 5.8 miles and is rated Moderate. Route via Long Trail with Pico Link spur.

Peak Bagging

**Extend Your Adventure:** Killington Peak lies just 3.4 miles away, making it an excellent addition for ambitious hikers looking to bag multiple summits.

spring.title: Spring Conditions
spring.tips: Trail closures for mud season (April-May). Check conditions before heading out.

summer.title: Summer Conditions
summer.tips: Start early to avoid afternoon storms and parking issues. Peak crowds on weekends.

fall.title: Fall Conditions
fall.tips: Peak foliage brings peak crowds. Weekday hikes recommended. Watch for ice above treeline in late October.

winter.title: Winter Conditions
winter.tips: Traction devices recommended. Start early for daylight.

current_hazards: Hypothermia risk - temperatures 20-40°F colder at summit
Trail markers may be buried under snow
